model

Class PayloadSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.PayloadSegment

  • public class PayloadSegment
extends java.lang.Object
    A payload segment contains the restoration metadata and the payload.

      • PayloadSegment

        public PayloadSegment(java.io.File payload)
        This constructor is for spare algorithms with low capacity.
        Parameters:
        payload -

      • PayloadSegment

        public PayloadSegment(java.io.File carrier,
              java.io.File payload,
              AbstractAlgorithm algorithm)
        A payload segment consists of: START_SEQ, restoration metadata, END_HEADER_SEQ, payload bytes, END_SEQ. The restoration metadata is saved in a Properties class, and keeps the name of carrier and payload, as well as their checksums and the name of the algorithm used to encapsulate.
        Parameters:
        carrier -
        payload -
        algorithm -

      • getPayloadSegment

        public static PayloadSegment getPayloadSegment(byte[] encapsulatedBytes)
        This method parses the bytes of an encapsulated file from least to first for the least payload section of the file. Beware that the parentCarrier can contain additional payload sections! This method will return null, if no payload sections are left and otherwise a PayloadSegment class which contains the restored payload and the restoration metadata.
        Parameters:
        encapsulatedBytes -
        Returns:
        PayloadSegment class, or null if no payload section available

      • getPayloadSegmentBytes

        public byte[] getPayloadSegmentBytes()
        The payload segment consists of the restoration metadata and the payload information.
        Returns:
        payload segment as byte array

      • getRestorationMetadata

        public java.util.Properties getRestorationMetadata()

        Returns:
        restoration metadata

      • getRestorationMetadataBytes

        public byte[] getRestorationMetadataBytes()

        restoration metadata

      • removeLeastPayloadSegment

        public static byte[] removeLeastPayloadSegment(byte[] encapsulatedData)
        Copy the encapsulation file to the restoration directory first, to be sure that you won't touch the file in the encapsulation output directory.
        Parameters:
        encapsulatedData -
        Returns:
        altered carrier file...
